meanings.definition: Arrange in a systematic order or plan.
meanings.sent1: She methodized her study schedule by color-coding each subject.
meanings.sent2: He methodized his closet by sorting clothes by color and type.
meanings.sent3: The ants methodized their march in perfect formation, like tiny soldiers.
meanings.sent4: Her mind methodized the chaos of thoughts into neat, labeled boxes.
meanings.sent5: The librarian methodized the books on the shelves with precision and care.

meanings.sent1: He methodized his daily routine to include exercise and healthy meals.
meanings.sent2: She methodized the paperwork by creating a detailed filing system.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels methodized their nut collection in a secret underground vault.
meanings.sent4: His approach to problem-solving methodized the chaos into clear steps.
meanings.sent5: The teacher methodized the lesson plan to ensure all topics were covered thoroughly.
